channel.title: Essays by Daniel Netzl
channel.description: Essays on AI, society, limits, and rethinking progress.

item.title: Why We Accept a Life We Constantly Need a Break From
item.description: A provocative look at why modern life is structured around exhaustion and escape.

item.title: Lost in the Scroll: How Algorithms Quietly Control What We Think and Want
item.description: An essay on the dark psychology of algorithmic media and its impact on autonomy.

item.title: The Lost Ark and the Illusion of Obligatory Technology
item.description: Why society treats technology like destiny - and what that says about our fears.

item.title: Racing Toward Collapse: How Our Fear of Limits Drives Us Off A Cliff
item.description: Our cultural rejection of limits is accelerating collapse. Can we stop the race?

item.title: A World Too Much: Finding Common Ground in a Fractured Political Landscape
item.description: Where far-left and far-right frustrations meet - and how we might build a new story.

item.title: The Myth of Progress: How Technology Became Our Defining Narrative
item.description: Why technological progress became a religion and what alternatives exist.

item.title: AI and the Uneven Scales of Progress: Inequalities in Development
item.description: How AI fuels global inequality and deepens environmental injustice.

item.title: Rethinking Progress in the Age of AI: A Call for Ethical Technology
item.description: A call to reimagine AI's purpose around human well-being and planetary boundaries.
